DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate whether regular moderate- high-intensity interval training change DNA methylation long-lasting state , whether change affect gene expression . In addition , investigator determine whether intensity training could affect factor possible DNA-methylation change well . The null hypothesis exercise-induced change occur .
DOC.criteria: Male 7075 year old Signed write informed consent Incompatible exercise Known cardiac disease Active cancer Significant pulmonary disease Uncontrolled hypertension Use blood thin medicine ( except AlbylE ) Drug abuse Alcohol abuse Finishing le 80 % exercise session ( complies train group )
